headline.main: TWO WEEKS LATER FROM CALIFORNIA.; Exposure of the Lemantour Frauds. PROGRESS OF THE REVOLUTION IN PERU. LATER FROM THE SEAT OF WAR IN NICARAGUA. News from New-Granada and the South Pacific. Unconstitutionality of the State Debt. PUBLIC OPINION AGAINST REPUDIATION. ARRIVAL OF THE GEORGE LAW. Highly Important Decision in the Supreme Court. $1,269,177 IN TREASURE.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States Mail steamer George Law, WM. LEWIS HERNDON, U. S. N., Commander, from Aspinwall Jan. 4, 5 o'clock A. M., with the mails passengers and treasure for New-York, brought down by steamer Sonera, arrived yesterday morning.
docs.abstract: Arrival of Mr Morse at Bogota

headline.main: The News of Forney's Defeat--The Investigating Committee-Orean Mail Steamers--European Difficulties--Kansas Affairs.

docs.lead_paragraph: The news of the election of CAMERON as Senator from Pennsylvania over FORNEY was received while the House was in session. The intelligence soon spread, and occasioned much excitement everywhere.
docs.abstract: Defeated by Cameron in contest for Pa. senatorship
docs.snippet: The news of the election of CAMERON as Senator from Pennsylvania over FORNEY was received while the House was in session. The intelligence soon spread, and occasioned much excitement everywhere.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Board of Aldermen. Board of Councilmen. Board of Supervisors. Contested Seat in the Councilman Board. A New City Charter. City Finances. City Mortality. Coroner's In nest. The Cold Term is Still On.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Board of Alderman met yesterday, at 5 P. M., the President, JOHN CLANOY, Esq., in the Chair. NOMINATIONS BY THE MAYOR. A communication was received from the Mayor nominating Oscar Bogart as Clerk in the Lower Police Court, in the place of Christian B. Woodruff, resigned. The nomination was confirmed. Another communication was received renominating

headline.main: THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROPE; THREE DAYS LATER FROM EUROI ARRIVAL OF THE ASIA. THE PARIS CONFERENCES. Proposed Med??ation of England in the Neutchatel Question. Banqnet to the American Officers of the Resolute. ADVANCE IN ??TION--BREADSTUFFSFIRM CONSOLS 94 a 94 1-8.

docs.lead_paragraph: The British mail steamer Asia, from Liverpool 10 o'clock morning of Saturday, the 27th, arrived at this port yesterday morning. The Asia brings on freight $3,300 sterling, $20,000 in gold, and 75,000 frances. The United States mail steamer Ericemr sailed from Liverpool at 6 o'clock on the evening of Wednesday, 24th, for New-York.

docs.lead_paragraph: A memorial was presented from the banks in New-York, asking for an increase of salary to the Bank Superintendent. A report from Western House of Refuge was presented, asking $35,000 from the State. Mr. SPENCER reported a bill to authorize the American and Foreign Bible Society to purchase $150,000 more of roal estate.

headline.main: LATEST INTELLIGENCE.; Great Excitement among Congressmen and Outsiders--The Shawnee Indian Lands--Minister for the Netherlands, &c. FROM WASHINGTON. By Telegraph to the New-York Daily Times. Magnetic Telegraph Co.'s Offices--4 Hanover-st., and 181 Broadway. House Printing Telegraph--Office No. 21 Wall-street.

docs.lead_paragraph: The proceedings in the House on Friday have caused intense excitement among Congressmen and outsiders, and to-day has been a very busy one. Cliques of members and others have been collected about the hotels, engaged in earnest conversation about the matter, and canvassing for action here. after.

headline.main: ADDITIONAL FROM EUROPE.; The Paris Conferences--Are They Indefinitely Postponed? The Mails by the North American.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Constitutional publishes an article, evidently emanating from an official source, on the subject of the Conferences. It notices, for the purpose of contradicting them, the rumors which have found their way into "foreign journals" relative to an adjournment of the Conferences, the doubts entertained in high quarters as to the utility of opening them, and the new difficulties that have arisen from the

headline.main: BOARD OF COUNCILMEN.; THE NEW COMMITTEES. No Gas in the Burners--A Good Deal Outside.

docs.lead_paragraph: Noise and Confusion--A "Gallows" Start for the Young Board. The Board of Councilmen met last evening, the President, J. N. PHILLIPS, Esq., in the chair. Owing to the derangement of the gas apparatus from the frost, the sitting was conducted under an exceedingly feeble glimmer--the President, Clerk and Reporters being accommodated with candles.
